activity.name: Prevent
activity.description:
Bridgend College seeks to protect its staff and students against radicalisation and extremism. This course will enable you to understand the Government Counter Terrorism Strategy - Prevent. This strategy aims to help people who are at risk of becoming terrorists or supporting terrorism.
Prevent sits alongside long-established safeguarding duties and is part of the Counter-Terrorism Strategy meaning that specified authorities such as education, health, local authorities, police and criminal justice agencies (prisons, probation, youth justice) have a duty to help prevent people from becoming terrorists or supporting terrorism.
By completing the course, you will understand the root cause of radicalisation, extremism and what to do if you come across any concerning behaviours.
Bridgend College will fulfil its responsibilities as outlined by the Prevent Duty Guidance, for further education institutions in England and Wales.
